alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 3:42AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas along the Aroostook River between Caribou and Fort Fairfield. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 339 AM EST, an ice jam approximately 9 to 12 miles long remains on the Aroostook River between Fort Fairfield and Caribou. Law enforcement reports minor flooding on the Grimes Road and North Caribou Road due to backwater. The Grimes Road and North Caribou Road remains closed. - Low lying areas along the Grimes Road and North Caribou Road will be the most likely locations to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Caribou and Fort Fairfield. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.
